FuncDef:
The alarm-threshold linklost-value command sets an alarm threshold for link failure. When the number of faulty links reaches or exceeds the threshold, an alarm is displayed.
The undo alarm-threshold linklost-value command restores the default setting.
By default, the alarm threshold for link failure is 2.
CLIs: undo alarm-threshold { lpu | sfu } linklost-value slot <slot-id>

ParaDef.Info:
Sets an alarm threshold for link failure on an LPU.
-

Sets an alarm threshold for link failure on an SFU.
-

Specifies an alarm threshold for link failure.
The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 16.

Specifies the slot number of an LPU or an SFU.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
In the case of more than two links, an alarm does not arise if the number of faulty links is below the alarm threshold.In the case of one or two links, an alarm arises as long as one link becomes faulty.if the number of faulty links is below the alarm threshold and does not reach half of the total link number, no alarm will arise.if the number of faulty links is below the alarm threshold but reach half of the total link number, an alarm will arise.

Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
